Class Molecule

  • java.lang.Object
    • Molecule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Immutable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Catalyst, Fragment

    public class Molecule
extends java.lang.Object
implements Immutable, java.io.Serializable
    Represents a molecule. This class is effectively immutable and serializable. The connectivity graph is not exposed because it is potentially mutable.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • moveAtoms

        public Molecule moveAtoms(java.util.Map<Atom,Atom> atomMap)
        Factory method to create a molecule given a map of old atoms to new atoms. Should be used to move atoms.
        Parameters:
        atomMap - a map from old atoms to new atoms (does not have to include all atoms)

      • transform

        public Molecule transform(Rotation rot,
                 Vector3D shift)
        Factory method to create a new molecule by transforming this one. The rotation is applied before the translation.
        Parameters:
        rot - a three-dimensional rotation that we apply to the Atoms in this to get the Atoms in the output
        shift - a vector that we add to the positions of the Atoms in this to get the positions of the Atoms in the output
        Returns:
        this rotated by rot, plus shift

      • shift

        public Molecule shift(Vector3D shift)
        Factory method to create a new molecule by shifting this one. Uses Rotation.IDENTITY as a parameter in the transform method
        Parameters:
        shift - a vector that we add to the positions of the Atoms in this to get the positions of the Atoms in the output
        Returns:
        this plus shift

      • normalize

        public Molecule normalize()
        Factory method to create a new molecule by shifting this one to have its center at the origin.
        Returns:
        this shifted by minus the barycenter of this

      • getCentroid

        public Vector3D getCentroid()
        Returns the centroid of this molecule.
        Returns:
        the centroid vector

      • transformAndCombine

        public Molecule transformAndCombine(Rotation rot,
                           Vector3D shift,
                           Molecule other)
        Create a new Molecule that is a transformed copy of this one, with the Molecule other added to it. There will be no bonds between the transformed copy and other. The rotation is applied before the translation.
        Parameters:
        rot - a three-dimensional rotation that we apply to the Atoms in this to get the Atoms in the output
        shift - a vector that we add to the positions of the Atoms in this to get the positions of the Atoms in the output.
        other - a Molecule that we throw in at the end
        Returns:
        two Molecules combined into a single Molecule; null if they are too close

      • containsAtom

        public boolean containsAtom(Atom atom)
        Determines if this Atom is contained in this Molecule.
        Parameters:
        atom - the atom that is supposed to be in this molecule
        Returns:
        true if the atom is in the molecule

      • getAtomNumber

        public int getAtomNumber(Atom atom)
        Returns the number of the atom. Answers are given in 1,2,...n where n is the number of atoms in the molecule.
        Parameters:
        atom - an Atom in this Molecule
        Returns:
        the requested atom number (-1 if it is not in the molecule)

      • getAtomString

        public java.lang.String getAtomString(Atom atom)
        Returns the element and atom number of an atom. e.g., C5. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the Atom is not in the molecule.
        Parameters:
        atom - the atom whose string is desired
        Returns:
        the description of the atom

      • getClosestAtomString

        public java.lang.String getClosestAtomString(Atom atom)

      • getBondString

        public java.lang.String getBondString(DefaultWeightedEdge e)
        Returns a human-readable string for a bond like C5-C6 (1.0) where C5 and C6 are bonded together with an order of 1.0. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the edge is not in the molecule.
        Parameters:
        e - the bond
        Returns:
        the string

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the number of atoms in this Molecule.
        Returns:
        the size of this molecule

      • exploreGraph

        public java.util.Set<Atom> exploreGraph(Atom startingAtom)
        Given a single atom, returns a set of all connected atoms, including the specified atom. Uses a breadth-first search algorithm.
        Parameters:
        startingAtom - the atom to start exploring the connectivity from
        Returns:
        the atoms in the subgraph of the startingAtom

      • getHalfGraph

        public java.util.Set<Atom> getHalfGraph(Atom excludeAtom,
                               Atom includeAtom)
        Given a bond between includeAtom and excludeAtom, returns a set of atoms containing all the atoms on the includeAtom side of the bond, including includeAtom. Returns an empty set if includeAtom and excludeAtom are not directly bonded. Will throw an exception if includeAtom and excludeAtom form a ring.
        Parameters:
        excludeAtom - this atom will not be included in the result
        includeAtom - this atom will be included in the result
        Returns:
        the atoms on the includeAtom side of the graph

      • getHalfGraph

        public java.util.Set<Atom> getHalfGraph(int index1,
                               int index2)
        convenience method. 1,2,...n

        convenience method that returns atom numbers instead of atoms

      • getHalfGraphNumbers

                                                   int atomNumber2)
        Convenience method that returns atom numbers instead of atoms.
        Parameters:
        atomNumber1 - the atom number of the first atom (1, 2, ..., n)
        atomNumber2 - the atom number of the second atom (1, 2, ..., n)
        Returns:
        the set of atom numbers on the atomNumber2 side

      • directlyConnected

        public boolean directlyConnected(Atom atom1,
                        Atom atom2)
        Determines whether atom1 and atom2 share an edge (i.e., are bonded). No exception is thrown if these atoms aren't in the graph.
        Parameters:
        atom1 - test whether this atom is connected to the other atom
        atom2 - test whether this atom is connected to the other atom
        Returns:
        true if the atoms are bonded

      • setDistance

        public Molecule setDistance(Atom atom1,
                   Atom atom2,
                   double requestedDistance)
        Moves the group associated with atom2 to the specified distance. Motion occurs along the atom1-atom2 bond vector. Note that this returns a new molecule. No checks are made.
        Parameters:
        atom1 - this atom will be held fixed
        atom2 - this atom and anything connected to it will be moved
        requestedDistance - the requested distance in Angstroms
        Returns:
        a new Molecule containing the same connectivity but new positions

        public Molecule rotateAngle(Atom atom1,
                   Atom atom2,
                   Atom atom3,
                   double theta)

        Parameters:
        atom1 - will not be moved
        atom2 - will not be moved
        atom3 - will be moved
        theta - rotation in degrees

        public Molecule setAngle(Atom atom1,
                Atom atom2,
                Atom atom3,
                double theta)
        Set the atom1-atom2-atom3 angle to theta degrees, moving atom3 and its subgraph only. New molecule returned. No checks.
        Parameters:
        atom1 - not moved
        atom2 - not moved
        atom3 - moved
        theta - desired angle in degrees

      • setDihedral

        public Molecule setDihedral(AtomTorsion atomTorsion,
                   double theta)
        Returns a new Molecule with a rotated dihedral. Note that the old AtomTorsion will no longer point to the new Molecule.
        Parameters:
        theta - the desired dihedral angle in degrees
        Returns:
        the new molecule

      • setDihedralMap

                   double theta)
        Alias method.

      • setDihedral

        public Molecule setDihedral(IndexTorsion indexTorsion,
                   double theta)
        Returns a new Molecule with a rotated dihedral. Alias method. Note that the old IndexTorsion will still be valid for the new Molecule.

      • set_sp2

        public Molecule set_sp2(Atom atom1,
               Atom atom2,
               boolean forceAngle)
        Creates a new Molecule where atom2 and its subgraph have been moved to make atom1 sp2-hybridized (bond angles set at 120 degrees). Note that the new center will be sp2, but could have distorted torsion angles.
        Parameters:
        atom1 - the atom to be adjusted to sp2
        atom2 - the group to be moved
        forceAngle - true if we want to force the atom1alpha-atom1-atom1beta angle to 120 (safe for non-prolines)
        Returns:
        a new Molecule with adjusted hybridization

      • set_sp2_map

        protected java.util.Map<Atom,Atom> set_sp2_map(Atom atom1,
                                   Atom atom2,
                                   boolean forceAngle)
        Returns an atom map for setting atom 1 to sp2 geometry. Does NOT include bond length adjustment.

      • set_sp2

        public Molecule set_sp2(Atom atom1,
               Atom atom2)
        Alias method.

      • set_sp3

        public Molecule set_sp3(Atom atom1,
               Atom atom2)
        Creates a new Molecule where atom2 and its subgraph have been moved to make atom1 sp3-hybridized (tetrahedral geometry). Note that the new center will be sp2, but could have distorted torsion angles.
        Parameters:
        atom1 - the atom to be adjusted to sp2
        atom2 - the group to be moved
        Returns:
        a new Molecule with adjusted hybridization

      • set_sp3_map

        protected java.util.Map<Atom,Atom> set_sp3_map(Atom atom1,
                                   Atom atom2)
        Returns an atom map for setting atom 1 to sp3 geometry. Does NOT include bond length adjustment.

      • getAdjacentAtoms

        public java.util.Set<Atom> getAdjacentAtoms(Atom includeAtom)
        Returns the bonded neighbors of includeAtom. Does not include includeAtom itself.
        Parameters:
        includeAtom - the atom whose neighbors are to be searched
        Returns:
        the Atoms adjacent to includeAtom

      • adjacentTo

        public boolean adjacentTo(Atom includeAtom,
                 Element e)
        Returns determine if Atom is adjacent to another Atom of element e.
        Parameters:
        includeAtom - the atom whose neighbors are to be searched
        Returns:
        true if includeAtom is adjacent to another Atom of element e, false otherwise.

      • getBond

        public DefaultWeightedEdge getBond(Atom atom1,
                          Atom atom2)
        Returns the bond between atom1 and atom2. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if there is no such edge.
        Parameters:
        atom1 - one of the atoms
        atom2 - the other atom
        Returns:
        the bond

      • areSeparated

        public boolean areSeparated(Atom atom1,
                   Atom atom2)
        Checks if atom1 and atom2 are more than two bonds apart.
        Parameters:
        atom1 - the first atom
        atom2 - the second atom
        Returns:
        true if atom1 and atom2 are separated by three or more bonds

      • tooClose

        public boolean tooClose()
        Checks if the atoms in this molecule clash.
        Returns:
        true if there is a self-clash in this molecule

      • getOPLSenergy

        public double getOPLSenergy()
        Computes a rough Lennard-Jones steric energy for this molecule. Answer is normalized by the number of atoms; i.e. kcal/mol divided by the number of atoms. Atoms that are separated by one or two bonds are ignored. Atoms separated by more than Settings.CUTOFF_DISTANCE are also ignored.
        Returns:
        the steric energy

      • checkCloseContacts

        public boolean checkCloseContacts(Molecule oldMolecule)
        Checks if atoms are too close in a molecule, given another molecule whose atoms we know are not too close. Intended for assessing the result of dihedral changes. Does not assume the molecules have the same composition.
        Parameters:
        oldMolecule - the molecule this molecule was modified from
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one atom that is too close to another atom

      • checkCloseContacts

        public boolean checkCloseContacts()
        Checks if the atoms are too close in a molecule. The minimum distance is controlled by Settings.MINIMUM_DISTANCE. Computations are performed on the triangular distance matrix.
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one atom that is too close to another atom

      • tooClose

        public boolean tooClose(Molecule other)
        Check if this Molecule is too close to other.
        Parameters:
        other - the other molecule to which we compare this one
        Returns:
        true if an Atom of this is too close to an Atom of other, and false otherwise

      • tooFar

        public boolean tooFar(Molecule other)
        Check if this Molecule is too far from other.
        Parameters:
        other - the other molecule to which we compare this one
        Returns:
        true if every Atom of this is too far from every Atom of other, and false otherwise

      • isInteresting

        public boolean isInteresting(Molecule other)
        Check if this Molecule does not meet other in an interesting way. Interesting is defined as an intermolecular hydrogen bond. Implementation assumes there is only one adjacent atom to each hydrogen.
        Parameters:
        other - the other molecule to which we compare this one
        Returns:
        true if this is an interesting arrangement

      • calculateRMSD

        public static double calculateRMSD(Molecule molecule1,
                   Molecule molecule2)
        Calculates the "distance" between two molecules by comparing their positions.
        Parameters:
        molecule1 - the first molecule
        molecule2 - the second molecule
        Returns:
        the RMS average distance between the atoms in molecule1 and molecule2 in angstroms

      • calculateRMSD

        public static double calculateRMSD(Molecule molecule1,
                   Molecule molecule2,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> atomNumbers)
        Calculates the "distance" between two molecules by comparing their positions. Molecules are superimposed first.
        Parameters:
        molecule1 - the first molecule
        molecule2 - the second molecule
        atomNumbers - the atom numbers (1...N) of the atoms to be compared
        Returns:
        the RMS average distance between the superimposed molecules, counting only the atoms in the lsit

      • matchMap

        public java.util.Map<Atom,Atom> matchMap(Molecule newMolecule)
        Creates an atom map that matches atoms to new ones by index. For instance this is useful if you want to do operations only on the molecule part of a class, then rectify the contents of the class to match the product.
        Parameters:
        newMolecule - a molecule with the same number of atoms, indexed in the same order
        Returns:
        an atom map

      • superimpose

        public static Molecule superimpose(Molecule molecule1,
                   Molecule molecule2,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> atomNumbers)
        Superimposes two molecules based on a list of atom numbers. Superposition is performed using the Kabsch algorithm.
        Parameters:
        molecule1 - one of the molecules
        molecule2 - another molecule (superposition transformation will be applied to this vector)
        atomNumbers - the atom numbers (1...N) to use for the superposition
        Returns:
        a new Molecule, which is molecule2 rotated to be maximally superimposed with molecule1

      • setName

        public Molecule setName(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a deep copy of this molecule with a new name.
        Parameters:
        name - the new name
        Returns:
        the new molecule

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code of this molecule.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hash code

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks for object equality by comparing all fields.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to be compared to
        Returns:
        true if equal

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a textual description of this molecule.
        Overrides:

        the string
